fields.headline: Balaban's contract terminated by Villa
fields.bodyText: Aston Villa have terminated the contract of Bosko Balaban with immediate effect. The Croatian striker cost the club £5.8m when he joined on a five-year deal from Dinamo Zagreb in August 2001 but he has not started a single Premiership game. Balaban, who has won 15 caps for Croatia and scored six goals, was signed by John Gregory after firing 14 goals in 27 appearances for Dinamo in the 2000-01 season. He made eight substitute appearances in the league for Villa and his two starts came in the Uefa and Worthington cups in 2001. "It has been a nightmare two years," he said. "I signed for five years when I arrived and I have spent two years in the stand." Liverpool are braced to lose Harry Kewell for tomorrow's game at Newcastle. The Australian sustained an ankle injury after coming off the bench against Bolton on Wednesday. The Liverpool goalkeeper Jerzy Dudek had a scan yesterday on a knee problem picked up in that 3-2 defeat by Wanderers. Bolton's delight in the ir Anfield success has been tempered somewhat after Jay-Jay Okocha said he was considering his long-term future; he is free to sign a pre-contract elsewhere once the transfer window opens in the new year. "I'm happy at Bolton but I have to be thinking about my future as well," said the Nigerian striker, who has yet to be offered a new contract by Wanderers. Everton have taken the Russian international centre-half Viktor Onopko, 34, on a four-day trial. But any hopes of luring Sean Davis from Fulham appear to have been dashed after the midfielder confirmed he hopes to sign a new contract at Loftus Road. Arsenal will have to break the bank to sign the Spanish winger José Antonio Reyes after his agent claimed Seville had turned down a £21m bid. Italy's Pierluigi Collina heads a 12-strong list of referees for Euro 2004. Mike Riley is England's representative. The former Manchester United goalkeeper Raimond van der Gouw has signed for the rest of the season with the Dutch side RKC Waalwijk.
